question: Which intoxication is associated with Burton's line?
ideal_answer: Burton's line is characteristic for lead poisoning.

snippets.text: The patient's serum lead concentration was substantially elevated and he perhaps demonstrated Burton's line.
The second patient presented with abdominal pain and a Burton's line. The lead level was 52μg/dL and free erythrocyte protoporphyrin was 262μg/dL.

This paper sketches the early history and remembers the important contribution of Henry Burton, who described the gums to be bordered by a narrow leaden-blue line, about the one-twentieth part of an inch in width, whilst the substance of the gum apparently retained its ordinary colour and condition.
